qas.question: What was the name of the Universal production company based in Paris?
What was the name of Universal's French distribution company?
What was the English title of Le scandale?
Who directed The Day of the Jackal?
What film was known in English as Going Places?
Where did Universal set up a distribution company in 1950?
Where did Universal set up a production company in 1960?

plausible_answers.text: the unit was incorporated into the French Cinema International Corporation arm

qas.question: What was the name of the company established in 1960?

context: In the early 1950s, Universal set up its own distribution company in <b5_0>France<b5_0/>, and in the late 1960s, the company also started a production company in <b6_0>Paris<b6_0/>, <a0_0><b8_0>Universal Productions France S.A<b8_0/>.<a0_0/>, although sometimes credited by the name of the distribution company, <a1_0>Universal Pictures France<a1_0/>. Except for the two first films it produced, Claude Chabrol's Le scandale (English title <a2_0>The Champagne Murders<a2_0/>) and Romain Gary's Les oiseaux vont mourir au Pérou (English title Birds in Peru), it was only involved in French or other European co-productions, the most noticeable ones being Louis Malle's Lacombe, Lucien, Bertrand Blier's <a4_0>Les Valseuses<a4_0/> (English title Going Places), and <a3_0>Fred Zinnemann<a3_0/>'s The Day of the Jackal. It was only involved in approximately 20 French film productions. In the early 1970s, <b7_0>the unit was incorporated into the French Cinema International Corporation arm<b7_0/>.
